website_summaries.verdict: Day hikers who love a lightweight yet supportive over-the-ankle boot will find the Hedgehog Hike II Mid GTX a satisfying product. Its share of good points proved its readiness for outdoor obstacles. It has a couple of drawbacks though. Having said that, the Hedgehog Hike II Mid GTX from The North Face is still a mid-performing hiking boot that ticked the trail basics.
pros: Several patrons who purchased The North Face’s Hedgehog Hike II Mid GTX commended its versatility
Its adequate ankle support was complimented by a couple of owners
A decent number of online buyers liked its lightness
About a handful of customers found an incredibly durable gear in this TNF hiking boot
The comfort provided by the TNF Hedgehog Hike II Mid GTX thrilled a few
Many users appreciated its snug fit
cons: A verified purchaser commented that it runs large
A conservative hiker did not like the moldy smell of the boot after getting submerged in water
He added that the stink was difficult to remove

customer_reviews.title: Great all-round boot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots to use on a 6 day Walking and wildlife week in the Scottish Highlands. I got them a month before I went, and gradually wore them in over this period. The boots kept my feet comfortable and dry during my trip, walking through marshland, rocky paths and climbing steep hills, averaging 5 and 6 miles a day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: as expected
customer_reviews.text: Its the North Face brand. Would you expect that to be nice looking? Yes! Would you expect that to fit? Yes. Would you expect that to be comfortable? Yes. Sooo. So far so good. My last boots lasted 8 years and I managed with them the Mont Blanc up to the Tete Rousse , Ben Nevis a few times to the top, Mount Teide once, Sniezska twice. Lets hop these new boots will be equally that good
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Reoccurring problem with quality of shoe
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous pair of North Face boots and now this pair has got the same problem. The material at the front of the boot has come apart as you can see on the pictures. Not something I expect from a NorthFace product and after a month of use. Will not be buying NorthFace again. These are being sent back for refund as will only get worse over time.
customer_reviews.author: GavSticks

customer_reviews.title: hurt my inner ankle
customer_reviews.text: my inner ankle was rubbed raw the first time i used them, it is sore :(
customer_reviews.author: BossLadyOffDuty

customer_reviews.title: Hard sole
customer_reviews.text: Came on time very hard sole need to get some gel insoles might help
customer_reviews.author: Steven mcc

customer_reviews.title: A big disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are fine in every respect except for one, they are not waterproof! I am really disappointed that a company with a name and reputation like The North Face could sell a product intended for use on long hikes in wild places, that doesn't do what they claim. I have had two pairs of these boots, the first pair were replaced by Amazon after a couple of months and the second pair are exactly the same.
customer_reviews.author: jon frost

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a very Good Pair of Walking Boots and saw these advertised. They were Reasonably Priced and Fitted Perfectly !!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharpy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good boots
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good boots. I've taken them on a couple of walks (15km plus each time). Sole is a bit on the hard side. And the leather needs a bit of breaking in. They're definitely water proof so far. I feel like I cant give 5 stars after 2 walks though so I may amend the review up or down depending on how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes, but...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, but the nozzle rubbers are already taking off with less than 4 months of use....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good and comfortable hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, comfortable and very good grip.Because these are Gortex they give great waterproof protection. They look good also
customer_reviews.author: Gadgetman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but bad design
customer_reviews.text: My ankle is bleeding from these boots. Had them for a week, there is a design flaw in that the hole is smaller than the shoe size. Don’t know what to do now as I disposed of the box. broken system..
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Sent them back, just no QA.
customer_reviews.text: Sent mine back because The quality was rubbish. Glue marks across the suede where the rubber was shoddily glued on and the had as much flex as a trainer. They were replacing a 7yr old pair of North Face boots and the difference was huge!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Walking Boots
customer_reviews.text: Really good walking boots. High quality and very comfortable. No need to bed these in, nice and snug from first use. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: The Malcy Bar Kid

customer_reviews.title: Very good stylish boots
customer_reviews.text: I like these boots. Fit comfortably and easy to walk in. I like the colour and look. Easy to clean. I have found them to be water proof on some very muddy and wet walks recently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy great looking boots
customer_reviews.text: Great fit! Look good! (Even better irl than in the photos!) Not cheap but appear to be of a quality you’d expect from North Face
customer_reviews.author: Rob N

customer_reviews.title: Definitely water proof.
customer_reviews.text: I like the non slip soles, I was walking on wet rocks and larger boulders, didn't slip once.
customer_reviews.author: George Whyte

customer_reviews.title: High quality but size....
customer_reviews.text: Light weight high quality boots. Unfortunately returned as too large, size not accurate..too large for my fit
customer_reviews.author: NORBERT F.

customer_reviews.title: All good
customer_reviews.text: Its the third time that I purchase the same model. I use them for hiking and when driving my motorcycle. Personally I am happy with it
customer_reviews.author: FOTIOS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit 🤘
customer_reviews.text: Ordered in the morning, arrived in the night. Top quality boot. Wicked grip and incredibly comfy compared to other boots I’ve bought for a similar price. Can’t fault these at all
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Comfy hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size as it is wide enough to wear proper boot socks, highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Antonio Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Really comfy
customer_reviews.text: Fit was perfect, really comfy boots. Used them on a recent Sli Holiday and my feet were always warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: MR TIMOTHY PUGH

customer_reviews.title: Solid boots
customer_reviews.text: Excelent quality product and service. Very solid shoes, excelent grip, waterproof. I have to test them in harder codtitions for longevity and possible injuries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good grip
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable. Very good grip. Put on and forgot. Very stable feeling
customer_reviews.author: Flyovis

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: really good hiking boots great price i am happy with the boots
customer_reviews.author: brian cassidy

customer_reviews.title: HIgh quality walking /hiking boot , very well made anf comfortable to were
customer_reviews.text: HIgh quality walking /hiking boot , very well made anf comfortable to were
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb Boots
customer_reviews.text: These are a great fit (8) and did not need breaking in, they were comfortable from the first wear. I've already walked over 24 miles, 8 in the snow, no leaks, a good grip and very warm. I had previously ordered NF Edgewood boots, but decided to use these for urban wear. The Hedgehogs are a more rugged boot, better suited, for me anyway, to hiking. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good Boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots were a very slightly smaller fit than I expected but nothing to worry about. They are also slightly more difficult to get on and off than my previous pair as they don't open as wide at the top. Once on however they are comfortable to walk in and seem good quality. I haven't yet had to test how waterproof they are but I expect they will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: William C

customer_reviews.title: Medium / high quality Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Every opinion about impermeability is correct. The sole is very good, high in the heel, the boot is light, although strongly manufactured. The only thing I did not like are the insoles, very simple for the price of the boot, but easy to solve with new ergonomics. I recommend them. They are narrow at the top, but open enough to fit them.
customer_reviews.author: JP

product_meta.title: The North Face Men's Hedgehog Hike Ii Mid Gore-tex High Rise Boots
product_meta.description: These Hedgehog Hike II Mid Gore-Tex shoes from The North Face feature a gore-tex membrane blocks out the wet, allowing you to take spring showers and shallow streams in your stride. A gusseted tongue keeps out kicked-up rocks and twigs. For protection against stone bruising, there’s an ESS snake plate and a comfy ortholite foot bed. To ensure you have traction on tricky surfaces, there’s a sticky vibram xs Trek outsole. These rugged, mid-cut hiking boots will keep any backpacker comfortable, safe and supported through all types of terrain.
feature_bullets: Mountain Footwear > Men's > Trekking Boots > Mid
